description: Commands to manage a Public-IP workload network.

commands.name: az vmware workload-network public-ip create
commands.summary: Create a Public IP Block by id in a private cloud workload network.
commands.syntax:
az vmware workload-network public-ip create --name
                                            --private-cloud
                                            --resource-group
                                            [--display-name]
                                            [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                            [--number-of-public-ips]
examples: az vmware workload-network public-ip create --resource-group group1 --private-cloud cloud1 --public-ip publicIP1 --display-name publicIP1 --number-of-public-ips 32

commands.name: az vmware workload-network public-ip delete
commands.summary: Delete a Public IP Block by id in a private cloud workload network.
commands.syntax:
az vmware workload-network public-ip delete [--ids]
                                            [--name]
                                            [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                            [--private-cloud]
                                            [--resource-group]
                                            [--subscription]
                                            [--yes]
examples: az vmware workload-network public-ip delete --resource-group group1 --private-cloud cloud1 --public-ip publicIP1

commands.name: az vmware workload-network public-ip list
commands.summary: List of Public IP Blocks in a private cloud workload network.
examples: az vmware workload-network public-ip list --resource-group group1 --private-cloud cloud1

commands.name: az vmware workload-network public-ip show
commands.summary: Get a Public IP Block by id in a private cloud workload network.
examples: az vmware workload-network public-ip show --resource-group group1 --private-cloud cloud1 --public-ip publicIP1

commands.name: az vmware workload-network public-ip wait
commands.summary: Place the CLI in a waiting state until a condition is met.
